intro: Sideritis candicans var. eriocephala, commonly known as the woolly sainfoin, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its upright, branched stems and small, hairy leaves that are often grayish-green in color. The plant produces clusters of tiny, pale blue to purple flowers, which bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or arid environments. Sideritis candicans var. eriocephala is a member of the Lamiaceae family, known for its aromatic properties and historical use in herbal medicine.
